intro: Haniffia albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered haniffia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate white flowers and slender, branched stems. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both ecological studies and horticultural research.
